detailed_description.textblock:
INTRODUCTION: Type 2 diabetes is a metabolic disease characterized by partial insulin deficiency or insulin resistance in peripheral tissue. Type 2 diabetes, which has a very high prevalence worldwide, is a socially serious health problem. Complications seen with the disease negatively affect human health. Physical activity and regular exercise are shown in the first place with pharmacological treatment and diet approaches in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes. Exercise has beneficial effects on the glycemic profile, such as decreased glycemic hemoglobin (HbA1c) level, increased maximum oxygen consumption (VO2max) and improved insulin sensitivity in diabetes patients. When the literature is examined, it is seen that exercise is also effective in improving metabolic health. Although the metabolic benefits of exercise have been shown, there is no study of which type of exercise is more beneficial in what time of day in individuals with Type 2 diabetes. Circadian rhythm plays an important role in clarifying this issue because the circadian rhythm is impaired in the glucose metabolism of individuals with type 2 diabetes.
AIM: The aim of this study is to investigate which exercise is more effective in which time period for individuals with Type 2 diabetes.
METHOD: 30 people with Type 2 diabetes in accordance with the criteria for inclusion in Koşuyolu Medipol University Hospital Internal Medicine Policlinic will be included in our project. Individuals who have been diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes between the ages of 35-65, who are between the ages of 35-65, who have body mass index between 25 and 30, who have HbA1c value> 6.5%, who have fasting blood glucose>126 mg/dl, who have Type 2 diabetes between 5-10 years, who have inactive physical activity, who independently can walk and volunteer to exercise for at least 3 days a week will be included in our project. Type 1 diabetes individuals, diagnosed with Latent Autoimmune Diabetes in Adults (LADA), having diabetic Ketoacidosis coma, orthopedic or surgical problems to prevent walking and exercising, foot ulcers, individuals have any neurologıcal problem and individuals with cardiac, pulmonary or systematic diseases that will cause contraindications will not be included in the study. Blood sample evaluations, circadian t rhythm evaluation, anthropometric measurements, muscle strength assessments, 6-minute walking test, 30-second sit to stand test, balance assessments with the Berg Balance Scale, quality of life assessment with Ferrans&Powers Quality of Life Index, sleep quality assessment with Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index of the individuals included will be carried out 6 weeks before starting the exercises, starting the exercises and 6th and 12th weeks after the exercise. Participants will be divided into two groups, morning and evening chronotypes, according to their circadian rhythms. The first group will have a total of 12 weeks of aerobic exercise for the first 6 weeks in the morning and the next 6 weeks in the evening. In the second group, 12 weeks strengthening exercises will be done in the first 6 weeks in the morning and 6 weeks in the evening. Evaluation measures of both groups will be compared in the middle and after the treatment. Based on the results to be obtained, what is the most suitable exercise type for individuals with Type 2 diabetes and the effectiveness of the exercises given in accordance with the circadian rhythm will be proved.

primary_outcome.measure: Circadian Rhythm Evaluation with Morningness Eveningness Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Scores can range from 16-86. Scores of 41 and below indicate "evening types". Scores of 59 and above indicate "morning types". Scores between 42 and 58 indicate "intermediate types" in Morningness Eveningness Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.description: An increase in the distance walked indicates improvement in basic mobility.
The wide variety of ability levels indicates with high scores
A score of 56 indicates functional balance. A score of < 45 indicates individuals may be at greater risk of falling.
High scores indicates high Quality of life in individuals with diabetes

Each item is weighted on a 0-3 interval scale. The global PSQI score is then calculated by totaling the seven component scores, providing an overall score ranging from 0 to 21, where lower scores denote a healthier sleep quality.

arm_group.description: The first group will have a total of 12 weeks of aerobic exercise for the first 6 weeks in the morning and the next 6 weeks in the evening.
In the second group, 12 weeks strengthening exercises will be done in the first 6 weeks in the morning and 6 weeks in the evening

intervention.intervention_name: Aerobic Exercises According to Circadian Rhythym
intervention.description: Total of 12 weeks aerobic exercises in different timing of the day.

intervention.intervention_name: Strengthening Exercises According to Circadian Rhythym
intervention.description: Total of 12 weeks strengthening exercises in different timing of the day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Type 2 diabetes
- Between the ages of 35-65
- Body mass index between 25 and 30
- HbA1c value> 6.5%
- Fasting blood glucose>126 mg/dl
- Inactive physical activity level
- Who independently can walk and volunteer to exercise for at least 3 days a week
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Type 1 diabetes
- Clinical diagnosis of Latent Autoimmune Diabetes in Adults (LADA)
- Having diabetic Ketoacidosis coma
- Orthopedic or surgical problems to prevent walking and exercising
- Foot ulcers
- Neurologıcal, cardiac, pulmonary or systematic diseases
